name: Instel's Hub
subtitle: WIP
description: Welcome to Instel's Hub! Instel's Hub is an actively maintained AltStore source, continuously updated to provide users with a variety of apps and tweaks not available on the official App Store. The source is regularly refreshed with new applications, bug fixes, and compatibility updates for the latest iOS versions. The focus is on delivering a seamless experience with a growing library of tools designed to enhance the iOS ecosystem, ensuring that users always have access to the most reliable and useful content available.

apps.name: OldOS
apps.subtitle: OldOS is a testament to the days of iOS 4.
apps.localizedDescription:
OldOS is a testament to the days of yesteryear, showcasing what iOS once was ten years ago. The ethos of the app is to merge the technologies of today with a pixel-perfect recreation of the user experience of the past. The vast majority of apps in OldOS are fully functional ‚Äî meaning they seamlessly integrate with the data on your phone to deliver a live, emulator-esque experience. What does this mean? Well, you can play your music in iPod, get directions in Maps, surf the web in Safari, view the current weather in Weather, and much more. By the same token, no shortcuts were taken in fully fleshing out the operating system. You can change your background, adjust settings, search apps, et cetera. There are a few apps still not ready for primetime but don't worry, they're coming soon.

With OldOS, you no longer need to worry about securing a legacy iPhone to experience nostalgia ‚Äî it's available on your daily driver.

Part of the goal with OldOS is to enable anyone to understand how iOS works and demonstrate just how powerful SwiftUI truly is. For that reason, the entire app is open-sourced ‚Äî enabling developers to learn about, modify, and add to the app. I thought building this over my last six or so months in high school and sharing it with the world would be a fun and productive endeavor.

Special Features:
* üßë‚Äçüíª Built almost entirely using SwiftUI.
* üé® Designed to be as close to pixel-perfect as possible.
* üì± Fully functional, perhaps even usable as a second OS.
* ‚ù§Ô∏è A testament to the work of Apple employees of both the past and the present.
* üó∫Ô∏è Fully open source for all to learn, modify, and build on.

versions.localizedDescription:
# IPA V1.0 Build 18

1.0 (18):
- Mail is here! This is a full-blown email client, no ifs, ands, or buts
- View mailboxes, read emails, move emails, manage inbox, and send emails
- Fixes to YouTube backend
- Other bug fixes

privacy.name: AppleMusic

privacy.name: Camera

privacy.name: Contacts
privacy.usageDescription: To view and manage your contacts in OldOS, please enable access to your contacts list.

apps.name: Mini vMac
apps.subtitle: A miniature early Macintosh emulator.
apps.localizedDescription:
Features

• Emulates Mac Plus, Mac II or Mac 128K
• Full simulated keyboard (including all Mac keys)
• Full sound output
• Uses external keyboard if available
• Regulable emulation speed
• Easy(ish) to import/export disk images

Please check out the github README for usage instructions: https://github.com/zydeco/minivmac4ios

versions.localizedDescription:
# Mini vMac for iOS v2.6

* Added 512×384 variant of Mac II
* Requires iOS 13.4
    * Dropping 32-bit support (iOS 9) made the app smaller
* Prefer pixel-perfect scaling when display scaling filter is set to nearest
* Auto-hide iOS home indicator
* Partially fix some command-key shortcuts going to iOS instead of the emulated Mac (#45)
    * ⌘-w and most others will get passed to the emulated machine if it's running
    * ⌘-q and ⌘-h don't seem interceptable, the app doesn't receive any key events for them, but ⌘-q doesn't do anything (or maybe it does in some other configuration?), and ⌘-h will take you to the home screen
* visionOS support (only tested in simulator)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/zydeco/minivmac4ios/compare/v2.5...v2.6

# Mini vMac for iOS 2.5

* Update to Mini vMac 37.03 beta
* Fixed crash when deleting disk images on iPad
* Adds recently used disks to quick actions menu
* Removed custom presentation modes for disk and settings screens
* Doesn't show "The developer of this app needs to update it to work with this version of iOS" error when installing IPA on iOS 15

apps.name: Clip
apps.subtitle: Manage your clipboard history with ease.
apps.localizedDescription:
Clip is a simple clipboard manager for iOS. 

Unlike other clipboard managers, Clip can continue monitoring your clipboard while in the background. No longer do you need to remember to manually open or share to an app to save your clipboard; just copy and paste as you would normally do, and Clip will have your back.

In addition to background monitoring, Clip also has these features:

* Easily view your clipboard history
* Search through past items
* Copy items back to the clipboard for easy reuse
* Works fully offline, no cloud syncing or internet required
* View your clipboard content as plain text, rich text, URLs, and images
* Supports unlimited clipboard history, no need to worry about missing past items
* Compatible with iOS 14+
